place.name: TREVERBYN
place.gazetteerText: TREVERBYN, a chapelry in St. Austell parish, Cornwall; near St. Austell r. station. It was constituted in 1846. Post town, St. Austell. Pop., 2,109. Houses, 411. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £160. Patron, alternately the Crown and the Bishop. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
